title: Honoring Mark DeNise upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by Con-way Freight
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Mark  DeNise upon the occasion of his
designation for special recognition by Con-way Freight

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to publicly  recognize
those  extraordinary  individuals  who  have  made  contributions to the
cultural enrichment of the State of New York, and  to  the  success  and
progress of society in the course of their life's work; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Mark
DeNise upon the occasion of his designation for special  recognition  by
Con-way Freight; and
  WHEREAS, Mark DeNise, a resident of Honeoye Falls, New York, and driv-
er  sales representative for Con-way Freight, has obtained a major mile-
stone in acquiring one million miles of safe driving  without  an  acci-
dent; this accomplishment is the ultimate measure of excellence; and
  WHEREAS,  Mark  DeNise safely drove the one million miles beginning in
August of 2000, and just recently obtained  the  outstanding  mark;  his
impressive  achievement highlights the personal and professional commit-
ment to safety he has executed for over 10 years driving for the Roches-
ter service center at Con-way; and
  WHEREAS, Working for Con-way Freight since  1995  and  having  been  a
professional  truck  driver  for  25 years, Mark DeNise typically drives
approximately 500 miles per shift, and his route takes him from  Roches-
ter to Lordstown, Ohio; he is a true asset to society; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout  have been his children, Ted, Nickole,
Cherle, and Jeramiah, as well as his grandchildren, Sean, Jonathan,  and
Samantha,  all  of  whom  feel  privileged  to be a part of his life and
rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Mark DeNise upon the  occasion  of  his  designation  for  special
recognition by Con-way Freight; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Mark DeNise.
